questions.question_text:
The postal service uses a system based on the Microsoft Database to manage the delivery of packages.
To improve the delivery service, the management requires the delivery staff to use personal cell phones to communicate the location and the exact time of each delivery.
You need to design a solution.
What should you do?

choices.C: Create a UI flow that sends the delivery time and location
choices.A: Create a button flow with user input for the delivery time and location
choices.D: Create a button flow with full address and timestamp trigger tokens
choices.B: Create a button flow with full address and date trigger tokens

discussion.content: Definitely D

Selected Answer: D
Timestamp and Full address are trigger tokens
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-automate/introduction-to-button-trigger-tokens

Selected Answer: D
D. Timestamp trigger token captures both the date and time. Date trigger tokens capture only the date component.

Selected Answer: D
Timestamps is a trigger token : https://powerautomate.microsoft.com/fr-be/blog/button-trigger-tokens/

comments.content: Don't listen to this answer. They did not read clearly and the correct answer is option D.
D has the full address as well!!!

discussion.content:
B. Create a button flow with full address and date trigger tokens.

Explanation:

In this scenario, the management requires delivery staff to communicate the location and the exact time of each delivery to improve the delivery service. The best way to achieve this with Power Apps is to create a button flow that includes full address and date trigger tokens.

Option A is not the best solution because it requires user input, which may not always be reliable or consistent.

Option C is also not the best solution because a UI flow requires more complex configuration and can be more difficult to maintain than a button flow.

Option D includes a timestamp trigger, but does not include a full address trigger, which is important for accurate delivery tracking.

Therefore, option B is the best solution as it includes both a full address and a date trigger, which will allow the delivery staff to communicate the location and exact time of each delivery, which can then be tracked using the Microsoft Database system used by the postal service.

Change a solution publisher

You can change a solution publisher for an unmanaged solution by following these steps:
In the Power Apps portal, select Solutions, select … next to the solution you want, and then select Settings.
In the Solution settings pane, select Edit publisher.
Edit the Display name and Prefix columns to the values you want. The Option Value Prefixcolumn generates a number based on the publisher prefix. This number is used when you add options to choices and provides an indicator of which solution was used to add the option.
In addition to the prefix, you can also change the solution publisher display name, contact information, and address in the Contact Details section.
Select Save and Close.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A and C are the right answers for me:

D is not true: You can NOT add a component from one solution to another solution that has a different publisher. (It is possible to move the ownership of a component from one solution to another within the same publisher, but not across publishers.)

B is not true - When you change a solution publisher prefix, you can NOT change the schema name for existing components.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/alm/solution-concepts-alm
The publisher of a solution where a component is created is considered the owner of that component. The owner of a component controls what changes other publishers of solutions including that component are allowed to make or restricted from making. It is possible to move the ownership of a component from one solution to another within the same publisher, but not across publishers. Once you introduce a publisher for a component in a managed solution, you can’t change the publisher for the component. Because of this, it's best to define a single publisher so you can change the layering model across solutions later.
